DESCRIPTION: Reviews how experiments and data are collected for statistical analysis. Looks at population vs sample, errors in sampling, bias and methods of reducing bias, and how to use a random number table.

Looks at levels of measurement and the shape, measures of center (median, mean, mode), and measures of spread (standard deviation) of a data set. Also compares the measures for population vs the measures for sample.

EIDs: MAT.STA.223.L.1, MAT.STA.222.L.1, MAT.STA.252.L.1, MAT.STA.226.L.1, MAT.STA.226.2.L.1, MAT.STA.224.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Overview of creating bar graphs, pie graphs, frequency tables, histograms, frequency polygons, dot plots, stem-and-leaf plots, and box-and-whisker plots.

EIDs: MAT.STA.422.1.L.1, MAT.STA.422.2.L.1, MAT.PRB.424.L.1, MAT.PRB.425.L.1, MAT.PRB.420.L.1, MAT.PRB.320.L.1, MAT.PRB.322.L.1, MAT.PRB.326.L.1, MAT.PRB.330.L.1, MAT.PRB.332.L.1, MAT.PRB.510.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Reviews the probability of: simple events, non-simple events, complementary events, compound events, conditional events, independent events, and mutually exclusive events. Also looks at tree diagrams and counting, combination, and permutation.

Introduces discrete probability distribution and random variables (and notation), the linear transformation of random variable, and characteristics (mean, standard deviation, expected value, standard deviation) of probability distributions.
A look at the binomial experiment, binomial probability, binomial coefficient, and characteristics of the binomial probability distribution.
Overview of the geometric probability distribution (experiment, probability, and distribution) and Poisson probability distribution (experiment, probability, and distribution).
Looks at characteristics of a normal distribution curve, the empirical rule, z-score, standardizing normal curve, and approximating binomial distribution.
Introduces sampling distribution and parameter estimation, sampling error, the central limit theorem, confidence intervals, and estimating true mean and true proportion.
Brief overview of the t-distribution and t-test statistic.
Looks at hypothesis testing: null and alternate hypotheses, types of error, p value, how to test a mean hypothesis, and how to test a proportion hypothesis.
Overview of displaying two variables in scatter plots and identifying correlation and the correlation coefficient. Also looks at the least-squares regression line and residuals.
Looks at the chi-square statistic, contingency tables, goodness-of-fit test, test for independence, and test for homogeneity.
